title: How to forward, by selecting multiple emails, messages from my gmail inbox to one mail ID - Quora

response.answer_text: You can forward multiple emails at one time from your Web browser with Gmail. Though the feature is not easy to find, you can forward multiple messages to a recipient from the Filter dialog box. First, create a filter in the Filter dialog box that captures all messages to forward, then specify the email account for the recipient. You can create and store up to 20 filters in your Gmail account. Filters are saved in your account until you delete them.Step 1Log in to your Gmail account. Click the down arrow in the Search box to open the Filter dialog box. You can also click the “More” option, then click “Create Filter” to open the dialog box. Step 2Type a search criterion for the filter in any field. For example, type the email address of the sender in the From: field to filter emails from a specific sender. Click the “Search" icon. The filtered results display. Repeat to obtain the desired results, if needed. Once you obtain the results you want with the filter, proceed to the next step to save the filter. Step 3Click the “Create Filter with This Search” link to save the filter. The Filter Options dialog box opens. Step 4Click the “Add Forwarding Address" link, then click the “Add a Forwarding Address" button. Type the email address of the recipient, then click the “Forward It” check box. Step 5Click the “Also Apply Filter to X Messages” where “X” is the number of messages displayed by the filter. Step 6Click “Create Filter” icon. The selected messages are forwarded to the recipient Tip You can also create a filter based on a single message by clicking the message check box, then clicking the “More” button. Click “Filter Messages Like These,” then edit the Filter dialog box and options to add or delete filter criteria. Warning Note that all incoming messages that meet the criteria of your forwarding filter will be automatically forwarded until you delete the filter from your Gmail account. You must manually delete the filter to stop emails meeting the criteria from forwarding. Source:http://classroom.synonym.com/forward-multiple-emails-gmail-one-time-11791.html

Currently there is no straightforward way to forward "old" emails in bulk to another email account, just using the provided Gmail feature. Yes, you can use the Filter approach everyone is talking about here but it just forwards the new incoming emails, not the existing ones which are already in your Gmail. Hiver Shared labels allow you to do this precisely. Just move the emails under relevant Gmail labels and share your Gmail labels with your team. All email in your labels will appear exactly in your colleagues’ Gmail too. Even new replies to older email threads will keep getting shared automatically. Disclaimer: I’m associated with Hiver. Currently there is no such a button in Gmail, that you can select and forward messages . If these Emails that you want to forward has some common characteristics (e.g has the same subject or the sender is the same ) , then you can create a filter and forward them automatically. You can create a filter by clicking the button More -> Create filter .   If it is not possible for your case, then alternatively you can install Mozilla Thunderbird and send selected Emails as attachment to the address. (again normal forwarding is not possible).
